description: Prevents your AI from breaking code by revealing hidden file dependencies through git forensics.

driftDays.description: Days before a coupled file is considered stale

analysisWindow.description: Number of commits to analyze for coupling

tools.name: analyze_file
tools.description: Returns forensic history, hidden dependencies, and risk assessment. USE THIS before modifying files.

path.description: The ABSOLUTE path to the file (e.g. C:/dev/project/src/file.ts)

tools.name: ask_history
tools.description: Search git history for WHY code was written. IMPORTANT: Use SHORT, SPECIFIC KEYWORDS (e.g., 'serialization', 'race condition', 'timeout'). Do NOT use full sentences or long descriptions - they will return 0 results. Use when asking 'why does this exist?' or before removing code.

path.description: Optional: ABSOLUTE path to scope search to a specific file or directory

limit.description: Maximum number of results to return (default: 20)

query.description: A single keyword or short phrase (1-3 words max). Examples: 'serialization', 'race condition', 'Safari fix'. Do NOT use full sentences - git grep requires exact matches.

endLine.description: End line for line-range search (requires path). Used with startLine to trace history of a code block.

startLine.description: Start line for line-range search (requires path). Shows history of specific lines using git log -L.

searchType.description: Where to search: 'message' (commit messages only), 'diff' (code changes only), 'both' (default)
